Speaker: {f:5:Featherine}
Umineko Project (UP): "Logically, that is true. It's the same for people, witches, and even gods. If they lose interest and concern, they can die at any time. And if they regain that interest, they can revive at any time. ......However, though the concept of time does not exist in the world of gods, who can revive whenever they want, time shoots by like an arrow in the human world, and it is not so easy there..."
Steam (ST): "Logically, that is true. It's the same for humans, witches, and even gods. If they lose interest and concern, they can die at any time. And if they regain that interest, they can revive at any time. ...However, though the concept of time does not exist in the world of gods, and they can revive whenever they want, time shoots by like an arrow in the human world, and it isn't so easy there..."

And if they regain that interest, they can revive at any time. ......However, though the concept of time does not exist in the world of gods, who can revive whenever they want, time shoots by like an arrow in the human world, and it is not so easy there..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「理屈ではそうだ。人も魔女も神さえも。興味と関心を失えばいつでも死ねる。そして、それを取り戻せばいつでも蘇れる。……しかし、神の世界には時間の概念がないから、いつ蘇るも自在だが、矢の如く時が過ぎ去る人の世では、それは容易ではないな…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「理屈ではそうだ。人も魔女も神さえも。興味と関心を失えばいつでも死ねる。そして、それを取り戻せばいつでも蘇れる。……しかし、神の世界には時間の概念がないから、いつ蘇るも自在だが、矢の如く時が過ぎ去る人の世では、それは容易ではないな…」
Russian (RU): "Логически, да. То же самое касается людей, ведьм и даже богов. Утратив интерес, они могут в любой момент умереть. А вернув этот интерес, могут в любое время ожить. ......Тем не менее, хотя понятия времени нет в мире богов, которые могут ожить когда захотят, время в человеческом мире подобно стреле, и там всё не так просто..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Logicamente, sim. É o mesmo para pessoas, bruxas e até mesmo deuses. Se eles perderem o interesse e a preocupação, todos podem morrer a qualquer momento. E se recuperarem o interesse, eles podem reviver a qualquer momento. ......Porém, embora o conceito de tempo não exista no mundo dos deuses, que podem reviver quando bem entenderem, o tempo voa como uma flecha no mundo humano, e por isso não é tão simples..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「理論上是如此。人也好，魔女也好，就連神也罷。只要失去了興趣與關心，隨時都能死。並且，只要將之取回，隨時都能復活。……然而，神的世界沒有時間的概念，所以何時復活亦是隨意。不過，在光陰似箭的人世，這就不是件容易的事了…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「理论上是如此。人也好，魔女也好，就连神也罢。只要失去了兴趣与关心，随时都能死。并且，只要将之取回，随时都能复活。……然而，神的世界没有时间的概念，所以何时复活亦是随意。不过，在光阴似箭的人世，这就不是件容易的事了…」

PC Japanese (JP): 「……私の機嫌が良くなっただけのこと。…浮かれるな。私はお前の命など、しおり代わりに挟んだまま忘失する木の葉よりも軽んじているぞ…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……私の機嫌が良くなっただけのこと。…浮かれるな。私はお前の命など、しおり代わりに挟んだまま忘失する木の葉よりも軽んじているぞ…」
Russian (RU): "......У меня просто поднялось настроение. ...Не будь о себе слишком высокого мнения. Я расцениваю твою жизнь как лист, утерянный, прослужив закладкой..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Meu humor acabou de melhorar. ...Não fique se achando. Eu penso na sua vida como sendo uma simples folha de uma árvore, que pode se perder após ser usada como marca‐páginas..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……我僅僅是心情轉好了而已。…別得意忘形。在我眼中區區你的小命，乃是輕過了代書簽夾入書中就此遺忘的樹葉…」

Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Featherine} rocked back in her rocking chair and looked up at the ceiling, laughing as though the conversation itself was pleasant for her.
Steam (ST): {f:5:Featherine} rocked back in her rocking chair and looked up at the ceiling, laughing as though the conversation itself was pleasant for her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Featherine rocked back in her rocking chair and looked up at the ceiling, laughing as though the conversation itself was pleasant for her.

Steam (ST): Ange was slowly figuring out how to deal with this strange witch.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ange foi lentamente aprendendo como lidar com essa estranha bruxa.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……她也，亦是为烦闷所苦。

Umineko Project (UP): When a sick person has been in bed for a long time and gets too bored, they sometimes act in a rebellious way.{n}On the other hand, they also get a little bored of being treated kindly all the time.
Steam (ST): It's not uncommon for a sick person, who's bored from being bedridden for a long time, to start acting rebellious. On the other hand, they can also get a little bored of being treated kindly all the time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When a sick person has been in bed for a long time and gets too bored, they sometimes act in a rebellious way. On the other hand, they also get a little bored of being treated kindly all the time.
PC Japanese (JP): 病床の長い病人は、退屈が過ぎれば時にひねくれもする。その一方で、やさしくされることにも少し飽きている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 病床の長い病人は、退屈が過ぎれば時にひねくれもする。{n}その一方で、やさしくされることにも少し飽きている。
Russian (RU): Когда больным, которые подолгу в постели, становится слишком скучно, они иногда начинают буянить.{n}С другой стороны, им скучно и когда о них всё время заботятся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando uma pessoa doente passa muito tempo na cama e fica entediada, ela muitas vezes acaba agindo de forma rebelde.{n}Por outro lado, elas também ficam um pouco cansadas de sempre serem tratadas gentilmente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 久臥於病床的病人，若是悶過頭了，那就有時會偶爾耍耍小性子。{n}另一方面，對於被溫柔哄著也是稍微有點厭煩了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 久卧于病床的病人，若是闷过头了，那就有时会偶尔耍耍小性子。{n}另一方面，对于被温柔哄着也是稍微有点厌烦了。

Umineko Project (UP): She may want to be respected for her superiority, but it's probably more interesting for her when she's spoken to a little rudely.
Steam (ST): She may want to be shown respect for her superiority, but it's probably more interesting for her when she's spoken to rudely.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She may want to be respected for her superiority, but it's probably more interesting for her when she's spoken to rudely.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分を目上だと多少は敬ってもほしいが、少しぞんざいな口調で扱われる方が、多分、面白いのだ。
Russian (RU): Даже если она хочет, чтобы её уважали за превосходство, для неё интереснее, когда с ней говорят грубо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela deve querer ser respeitada por sua superioridade, mas provavelmente é mais interessante para ela quando falam com ela de forma mais rude.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然希望別人把自己當長輩地多少示以點敬意，但被以略微不拘禮的口吻對待，多半，是會令他們感到有趣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然希望别人把自己当长辈地多少示以点敬意，但被以略微不拘礼的口吻对待，多半，是会令他们感到有趣。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Umineko Project (UP): "Anyway. ......From what we learned in the fourth game, there's no doubt that there was some kind of bad blood between Beato and Onii‐chan in the past. Learning about this Beato might give us a key towards finding the truth."
Steam (ST): "Anyway, ...from what we learned in the 4th game, there's no doubt that there's been some kind of antagonism between Beato and Onii-chan in the past. Learning about this Beato might give us a key to finding the truth."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Anyway. ......From what we learned in the 4th game, there's no doubt that there's been some kind of antagonism between Beato and Onii-chan in the past. Learning about this Beato might give us a key towards finding the truth."
PC Japanese (JP): 「とにかく。……第４のゲームでベアトとお兄ちゃんに何か確執があったことは間違いないの。このベアトを知ることは、真相に至る鍵の一つになり得るわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「とにかく。……第４のゲームでベアトとお兄ちゃんに何か確執があったことは間違いないの。このベアトを知ることは、真相に至る鍵の一つになり得るわ」
Russian (RU): "Так или иначе...... судя по информации из четвёртой игры, в прошлом между Беато и братиком была какая‐то вражда. Информация об этой Беато может дать нам ключ к правде."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "De qualquer forma. ......Pelo que eu aprendi no quarto jogo, no passado houve algum tipo de antagonismo entre a Beato e o onii‐chan. Aprender sobre esta Beato pode nos dar alguma dica para encontrar a verdade."

Steam (ST): When Ange raised her hands like a conductor, the bookshelves in this bizarre study responded.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Ange raised her hands like a conductor, the bookshelves in this bizarre study responded.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, este estúdio do mundo dos não‐humanos pertencia ao mestre do tabuleiro......e localizava‐se onde ele poderia observar os {y:0:Humanos}{n:0:humanos} que estavam abaixo...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那麼這個，非人世界的書房，……即是俯瞰著人類的，這個棋盤的主君的房間。

Umineko Project (UP): Therefore, it was understandable that one might mistake the imposing, robe‐clad man in the center of the study for Kinzo, if only for a second.
Steam (ST): Therefore, one could hardly be blamed for mistaking the imposing, berobed man in the center of the study for Kinzo, if only for a second.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Therefore, it was understandable that one might mistake the imposing, robe-clad man in the center of the study for Kinzo, if only for a second.

Russian (RU): Поэтому человека в накидке, стоящего в центре кабинета, можно было по ошибке принять за Кинзо, но лишь на секунду.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Portanto, era compreensível que alguém pudesse confundir com Kinzo, o imponente homem que trajava um manto no centro do mesmo, mesmo que por um único segundo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，威風凜凜地立於書房中央的身披披風的男子，是或許會使人，一瞬看錯成金藏。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não era Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不對。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不对。

Steam (ST): ...This was Battler, the one who had taken up the position of Game Master, becoming the new territory lord of this world.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......This was Battler, the one who had taken up the position of Game Master and become the new territory lord of this world.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Traditional (CHT): [=JPC]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=JPC]

Umineko Project (UP): Around Battler was a swirl of glowing fragments, sparkling like the night sky, ......and on the floor was what appeared to be a red magic circle.
Steam (ST): Around Battler was a swirl of glowing Fragments, sparkling like the night sky, ...and on the floor was what appeared to be a red magic circle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Around Battler was a swirl of glowing Fragments, sparkling like the night sky, ......and on the floor was what appeared to be a red magic circle.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): But to Battler, who stood at its center, it was the outline for a new tale...

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Umineko Project (UP): ".........It seems you're quite a skilled reader. ...For most of my readers, it would be necessary to devote several hundred pages to explaining how a single human...can become different people depending on their upbringing and the passage of time."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........It seems you're quite a skilled reader. ...For most of my readers, it would be necessary to spend several hundred pages to explain how a single person can become different people depending on their upbringing and time."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………あなたはなかなか出来る読者のようですね。…並の読者相手だったら、同一の人間であっても、その生い立ちと時間によって、別人になりうることを説明するために数百ページを割かねばならぬというのに。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………あなたはなかなか出来る読者のようですね。…並の読者相手だったら、同一の人間であっても、その生い立ちと時間によって、別人になりうることを説明するために数百ページを割かねばならぬというのに」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Parece que você é uma leitora muito habilidosa. ...Para muitos de meus leitores, seria necessário devotar centenas de páginas para explicar como um único humano...poderia se tornar uma pessoa diferente, dependendo de como foi seu crescimento e sua passagem de tempo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………你看來是個相當有水平的讀者呢。…如果換成一般的讀者，那就必須分出數百頁來解釋，哪怕同一個人類，也是能夠隨成長與時間變成另一個人的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………你看来是个相当有水平的读者呢。…如果换成一般的读者，那就必须分出数百页来解释，哪怕同一个人类，也是能够随成长与时间变成另一个人的。」
